intro: Protium pubescens var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leafed sycamore, is a tropical tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey-barked trunk and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
